results.title: Texas Court Halts Abuse Inquiries Into Parents of Transgender Children
results.abstract: A judge said the governor’s order to consider medically accepted treatments for transgender youth as abuse had been improperly adopted and violated the State Constitution.

media.caption: People protested in Austin, Texas, this month against Gov. Greg Abbott’s order directing state officials to open abuse investigations into parents who provide hormones or puberty-suppressing drugs to their transgender children.

results.title: Emilio Delgado, Luis on ‘Sesame Street’ for Four Decades, Dies at 81

results.title: U.S. Officials Say Superyacht Could be Putin’s
results.abstract: They say they have indications that the $700 million, 459-foot yacht, which is in dry dock in Italy, is associated with the Russian president, backing an earlier claim by a former crew member.

media.caption: The Scheherazade dominates the waterfront in the small Italian town of Marina di Carrara where it has been moored since September.

results.title: New Vaccine Findings Pose Tough Questions for Parents of Young Children
results.abstract: The F.D.A. temporarily halted efforts to authorize the Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine for young children amid several unexpected findings. The coming weeks should bring clarity.

media.caption: A mobile vaccination van in Queens. Fewer than 25 percent of children ages 5 to 11 are fully vaccinated, and while more than half of adolescents 12 to 17 are fully vaccinated, only 12 percent have received a booster.

results.title: Melatonin Isn’t a Sleeping Pill. Here’s How to Use It.
results.abstract: The “vampire hormone” can act like a dose of sunset, tricking your body into feeling like it’s time to sleep.

results.title: Over Ukraine, Lumbering Turkish-Made Drones Are an Ominous Sign for Russia
results.abstract: The Bayraktar TB2 has become a rallying symbol for Ukrainians, who are singing songs about them and posting videos of their success.

results.title: Late-Winter Storm Set to Sweep Across the U.S. Into Saturday
results.abstract: Winter weather alerts were in effect on Friday from Tennessee to Maine. The Northeast will receive the most snow, with some places expecting a foot or more, meteorologists said.

media.caption: A late-winter storm swept through El Paso on Friday, giving palm trees in the area a rare coating of snow.

results.title: China Has Tools to Help Russia’s Economy. None Are Big Enough to Save It.

results.title: She Killed Two Women. At 83, She Is Charged With Dismembering a Third.

results.byline: By Maria Cramer and Isabella Grullón Paz
results.title: An Educator Read ‘I Need a New Butt!’ to Children. Then He Was Fired.
results.abstract: Toby Price, an assistant principal at an elementary school in Mississippi, read the book to a class of second graders over Zoom. “I am a firm believer that reluctant readers need the silly, funny books to hook them in,” he said.

media.caption: Toby Price, former assistant principal at Gary Road Elementary School in Hinds County, Miss., said he had hired a lawyer and planned to fight his termination.

results.title: They Died by a Bridge in Ukraine. This Is Their Story.

results.title: Hong Kong’s overwhelmed hospitals are keeping the dead in wards with Covid patients.
